About

Bay Area native with a strong appetite for technology and pop culture. I'm seeking a career change into the everlasting world of web development, and after two and a half years of training I'm ready for a junior role. I've survived two coding bootcamps and countless hours of self studying which has enabled me to produce numerous projects, gain a deep understanding of programming fundamentals and also become really really good at Googling things. Presently, I consider myself to be three-quarters of a full-stack developer. I'm more comfortable with front-end development but am quickly improving upon my back-end chops. When I'm not developing code, I love the outdoors, reading, being a musical connoisseur, going to shows, trying new restaurants, experiencing epiphanies, netflixing and putting sriracha on everything. Ah.
